standard_metadata.standard_description: Classify two-dimensional figures based on the presence or absence of parallel or perpendicular lines, or the presence or absence of angles of a specified size. Recognize right triangles as a category, and identify right triangles.

images.alt: A triangle XYZ. Side XY is 5 units long, side XZ is 5 units long, and side YZ is 5 units long. The angles at X, Y, and Z are acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{\text{3 equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has $\purpleC{\text{2 or 3 equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{\text{0 equal sides}}$.
###How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{XYZ}$ have?  [[☃ image 1]]  $\triangle{XYZ}$ has $\blueD{\text{3 equal sides}}$, so it also has $\purpleC{\text{2 or 3 equal sides}}$.

images.alt: A triangle XYZ. Side XY is 5 units long, side XZ is 5 units long, and side YZ is 5 units long. The angles at X, Y, and Z are acute angles. The length labels for all sides are highlighted.

hints.content: ###The answer  $\triangle{XYZ}$ is an $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle and an $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle DEF. Side DE is 7 units long, side DF is 7 units long, and side EF is 7 units long. The angles at D, E, and F are acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{\text{3 equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has $\purpleC{\text{2 or 3 equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{\text{0 equal sides}}$.
###How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{DEF}$ have?  [[☃ image 1]]  $\triangle{DEF}$ has $\blueD{\text{3 equal sides}}$, so it also has $\purpleC{\text{2 or 3 equal sides}}$.

images.alt: A triangle DEF. Side DE is 7 units long, side DF is 7 units long, and side EF is 7 units long. The angles at D, E, and F are acute angles. The length labels on all the sides are highlighted.

hints.content: ###The answer  $\triangle{DEF}$ is an $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle and an $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle ABC. The angle at A has a box at its vertex connecting lines AB and AC. Side AB is 5 units long, side AC is 5 units long, and side BC is 7 units long. The angles at B and C are acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{\text{3 equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has $\purpleC{\text{2 or 3 equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{\text{0 equal sides}}$.
###How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{ABC}$ have?  [[☃ image 1]]  $\triangle{ABC}$ has $\purpleC{2\text{ equal sides}}$.

images.alt: A triangle ABC. The angle at A has a box at its vertex connecting lines AB and AC. Side AB is 5 units long, side AC is 5 units long, and side BC is 7 units long. The angles at B and C are acute angles. The length labels for AB and AC sides are highlighted.

hints.content: ###The answer  $\triangle{ABC}$ is an $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle MNO. Side MN is 5 units long, side MO is 5 units long, and side NO is 4 units long. The angles at M, N, and O are acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{\text{3 equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has $\purpleC{\text{2 or 3 equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{\text{0 equal sides}}$.
###How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{MNO}$ have?   [[☃ image 1]]  $\triangle{MNO}$ has $\purpleC{2\text{ equal sides}}$.

images.alt: A triangle MNO. Side MN is 5 units long, side MO is 5 units long, and side NO is 4 units long. The angles at M, N, and O are acute angles. The length labels for MN and MO sides are highlighted.

hints.content: ###The answer  $\triangle{MNO}$ is an $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle DEF. Side DF is 4 units long, side FE is 4 units long, and side DE is 7 units long. The angles at D and E are acute angles. The angle at F is obtuse angle.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{\text{3 equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has $\purpleC{\text{2 or 3 equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{\text{0 equal sides}}$.
###How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{DEF}$ have?   [[☃ image 1]]  $\triangle{DEF}$ has $\purpleC{2\text{ equal sides}}$.

images.alt: A triangle DEF. Side DF is 4 units long, side FE is 4 units long, and side DE is 7 units long. The angles at D and E are acute angles. The angle at F is obtuse angle. The length labels for sides DF and FE are highlighted.

hints.content: ###The answer  $\triangle{DEF}$ is an $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle STU. Side ST is 9 units long, side SU is 6 units long, and side UT is 7 units long. The angles at S, T, and U are acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{\text{3 equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has $\purpleC{\text{2 or 3 equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{\text{0 equal sides}}$.
###How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{STU}$ have?  $\triangle{STU}$ has $\greenD{0\text{ equal sides}}$.
###The answer  $\triangle{STU}$ is a $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle JKL. Side JK is 4 units long, side KL is 5 units long, and side JL is 7 units long. The angles at J and L are acute angles. The angle at K is obtuse angle.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{\text{3 equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has $\purpleC{\text{2 or 3 equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{\text{0 equal sides}}$.
###How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{JKL}$ have?  $\triangle{JKL}$ has $\greenD{0\text{ equal sides}}$.
###The answer  $\triangle{JKL}$ is a $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle PQR. The angle at R has a box at its vertex connecting lines RP and RQ. Side RP is 5 units long, side RQ is 12 units long, and side PQ is 13 units long. The angles at P and Q are acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{\text{3 equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has $\purpleC{\text{2 or 3 equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{\text{0 equal sides}}$.
###How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{PQR}$ have?  $\triangle{PQR}$ has $\greenD{0\text{ equal sides}}$.
###The answer  $\triangle{PQR}$ is a $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle.

question.content: **Complete the table below to classify the triangles as scalene or isosceles.**  Triangle | Classification - | - | -  |   |    |

images.alt: A triangle with side lengths of 7, 8, and 10 units.
A triangle with side lengths of 3, 3, and 5 units.
A triangle with side lengths of 4, 5, and 2 units.

hints.content: An $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has $\purpleC{\text{2 or 3 equal sides}}$.  A $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{\text{0 equal sides}}$.
This triangle has $\greenD{\text{0 sides of equal length}}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, it is a $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle with side lengths of 7, 8, and 10 units.

hints.content: This triangle has $\purpleC{\text{2 sides of equal length}}$.    [[☃ image 1]]  So, it is an $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle with side lengths of 3, 3, and 5 units.

hints.content: This triangle has $\greenD{\text{0 sides of equal length}}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, it is a $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle with side lengths of 4, 5, and 2 units.

hints.content: Here is the completed table:  Triangle | Classification - | - | -  | Scalene  |  Isosceles  |  Scalene

images.alt: A triangle with side lengths of 7, 8, and 10 units.
A triangle with side lengths of 3, 3, and 5 units.
A triangle with side lengths of 4, 5, and 2 units.

question.content: **Complete the table below to classify the triangles as equilateral or not equilateral.**  Triangle | Classification - | - | -  |  |    |

images.alt: A triangle with side lengths of 3, 4, and 6 units.
A triangle with side lengths of 3, 3, and 3 units.
A triangle with side lengths of 1, 10, and 10 units.

hints.content: An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{\text{3 equal sides}}$.
This triangle has $0$ sides of equal length.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, it is **not** an equilateral triangle.

images.alt: A triangle with side lengths of 3, 4, and 6 units.

hints.content: This triangle has $\blueD{\text{3 sides of equal length}}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, it is an $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle with side lengths of 3, 3, and 3 units. The length labels for all sides are highlighted.

hints.content: This triangle has $2$ sides of equal length.  [[☃ image 1]]  So, it is **not** an equilateral triangle.

images.alt: A triangle with side lengths of 1, 10, and 10 units. The 10 units labels for two sides are highlighted.

hints.content: Here is the completed table:  Triangle | Classification - | - | -  | Not equilateral |  Equilateral  |   Not equilateral
